alert.note: Alert for Menominee; Shawano (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:53PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Menominee and central Shawano Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 253 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Embarrass, or near Shawano, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Shawano around 305 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Keshena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
